name: Batbout (Moroccan Flatbread)
steps: In a large bowl, mix flour, semolina, yeast, salt and warm water.
Knead until the dough is smooth and elastic.
Let the dough rest until doubled in volume.
Divide into balls, then flatten into discs about 1–2 cm thick.
Cook in a dry skillet (no oil) until both sides are golden and bread is puffed.
description: Simple and fluffy Moroccan flatbread, cooked on a skillet — ideal as accompaniment or sandwich bread.
